creator: 0xa423fe4cfb811e9cf6a61a02e80e372c0970d4b0
metadata:
Proposal to add new admin fee of 0.01% based on the proposal SIP-2 to fund the Swerve Treasury.

Snapshot Proposal: https://snapshot.page/#/swerve/proposal/QmNScXYzAzq3kXDV3BXmRkXSSKDw5q3yv7EEzM5rJ1FtJg

The original snapshot proposal passed for 35% admin fee, but for the sake of brevity and better reporting it has been decided by the community to round it off to 0.01% instead of 0.0105% which would be 33.33(bar)% in terms of admin fee applied to the trading fee as a %.

If this proposal passes, the trading fee would remain unchanged at 0.03% as passed in the previous parameter vote, 0.01% from the trading fee would be redirected towards Treasury.

The treasury would help us to cover all future development and R&D, pay back the community contributors, pay back Swerve for his initial expenses, and as Lex mentioned, would also help us have a war chest for any other requirement. This is a move towards making Swerve Finance have a more solid foundation, and future-proof stability and development.

creator: 0xa423fe4cfb811e9cf6a61a02e80e372c0970d4b0
metadata:
This is a bundled proposal for SIP-3 and SIP-5 which passed the signalling vote and is now up for implementation.

A low a factor increases liquidity around the theoretical price of 1 for all stablecoins, which improves liquidity at the expense of a healthy pool ratio. While that is fine under normal market conditions, DAI typically trades at a premium, and the current a factor of 1000 has the negative effect of enabling excessive trading volumes around 1 USD. This results in very low DAI reserves which is undesirable. SIP-5 proposed an amended value of 100.

The trading fee currently at 0.04% if changed to 0.03% as suggested in signalling vote SIP-3 could bring more volume and liquidity to the protocol.


SIP-3: https://snapshot.page/#/swerve/proposal/QmbB4d995Ly3KHJ71wchCVQgaRYZaTfow9tyCXuFxNCCwP
SIP-5: https://snapshot.page/#/swerve/proposal/QmYFBXmEPNKKEHCvgJekLYK846tV6cG2Z7Tf91BBoRoXHB
